subtitle: 10th day of the Omer Harmony and
restraint or compassion and restrained I
often feel that restraint although
necessary
and
very praiseworthy
discipline
is also sometimes rigid or can be rigid
and hard around the edges and can sort
of have us think in black and white
terms or become very polarized and when
you bring Compassion or Harmony into
your restraint into your discipline
you've softened the edges and you blend
and harmonize the discipline with the
love with the giving which was I said
which was last week
and therefore your view of life becomes
more true which is also another name for
the sphera of compassion as Ms which
means truth
